cleaned_text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that people who are moderately to severely immunocompromised (have a weakened immune system) receive 3 doses of a mRNA COVID-19 V accine* (Pzer or Moderna) rather than 2 doses recommended for other people. The 3rd dose is available as early as 28 days from the 2nd dose. For more information, visit coronavirus.dc.gov/vaccineAdditional COVID-19 V accine for People with Weakened Immune Systems Moderate or severe primary immunodeciency (such as DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Alrich syndrome) Been receiving active cancer treatment for tumors or cancers of the blood Advanced or untreated HIV infectionReceived an organ transplant and are taking medication to suppress the immune system Received a stem cell transplant within the last two years and are taking medication to supress the immune system Active treatment with high-dose corticosteroids or other drugs that may suppress immune responseThis includes people who have: *Currently, there are no recommendations for an additional dose of the Johnson and Johnson (Janssen) COVID-19 vaccine.
